main event: A report of an unidentified flying object sighted in Arlington, Virginia on March 7, 1954.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only two seconds and appeared as stars but exhibited movement., The evaluation of the sighting suggested it was probably a balloon or possibly an aircraft., An astronomer concluded it could be an astronomical phenomenon., The report indicated no color change was observed during the sighting., The detail of the sighting involves both Air Force and intelligence documentation.
witness description: 1st Lt. Ray H. Hoffer from the 833d AC&W SQ
